executive_summary: Rising awareness of oral health, growing incomes and tech advances have driven growth for orthodontists. Orthodontists specialize in teeth and jaw irregularities, so substitutes for care are limited, keeping orthodontists essential in addressing children's and adults' dental needs. Rising incomes have facilitated access to orthodontists as larger incomes allow patients to cover out-of-pocket costs. Public and private insurance payers often restrict orthodontic benefits.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Financial Pressures Offset the Post-COVID Jump in Patient Volume
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rising awareness of oral health, growing incomes and tech advances have driven growth for orthodontists in recent years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Even as consolidation ramps up, orthodontic practices are unlikely to encounter the same widespread consolidation occurring in other healthcare industries.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Independent practices will likely feel more threatened by critical staffing shortages than any uptick in OSOs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Enterprises Undergo a Post-Pandemic Jump in Patient Volume
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Patient volumes rebounded in 2021 as alleviating pandemic concerns encouraged patients to fill pent-up demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Orthodontists Benefit as More Adult Patients Put Their Money Where Their Mouth Is
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: More than 4.0 million people in the US receive orthodontic treatment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Orthodontic Practices Will Brace for Change
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consolidation activity will accelerate as orthodontic service organizations (OSOs) extend their resources into small, local practices.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Critical Staffing Labor Shortages Create Financial Strain
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Demand for orthodontic treatment will continue to outpace growth in the number of dentists.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Tech Advances Drive Growth But Introduce Risks
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Many orthodontic practices will adopt tech tools to help relieve some of the challenges affecting the broader health sector.

industry_definition: This industry is made up of health practitioners who specialize in treating misaligned teeth and facial development with braces, headgear, retainers and other methods.

negative_impact_factors: low to steady industry assistance level

opportunities: Federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid

key_trends: COVID-19 introduced unprecedented financial and operational pressures into orthodontic practices.
Changing competitive dynamics introduce consolidation into orthodontia.
Adult patients overwhelmingly visit orthodontists for cosmetic treatment.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Out-of-pocket costs include deductibles, coinsurance, copayments.

products_and_services.product_description: Orthodontic devices that correct misaligned teeth.
Other dental devices provided by orthodontists.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Traditional Braces Remain the Go-To Option for Straightening Teeth
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Orthodontist practices benefit from growing popularity.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Adult Patients Value Clear Aligners as a Stealthy Substitute for Metal Braces
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Tech advances have made clear aligners more discreet.

business_locations.location_description: More than one-quarter of the nation's population.
The West's large population elicits a high proportion of orthodontic practices.
States with large metro areas have a high concentration of industry.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Prohibits exchange of value to induce referrals.
Outlines controls for patient health data.

basis_points.basis_title: Growing number of direct-to-consumer teeth straighteners
Independent orthodontic practices are the status quo
basis_points.basis_description: Creating tense competition in saturated local markets.

FAQs.question: How have your markets been impacted by changing access to health insurance?
FAQs.answer: As people have gained insurance, they have been better able to afford orthodontic services.

FAQs.question: How do you make sure your prices are attractive to customers?
FAQs.answer: Even with dental insurance, orthodontic work carries a high price.

FAQs.question: Is your company geographically positioned in communities where there is a strong need?
FAQs.answer: Orthodontists often operate in central locations with large populations.
